intro: Scurrula roxburghii, commonly known as the Indian thorn apple, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, orange-red berries that are toxic to humans and animals. It thrives in dry, arid environments and is often found in wastelands and along roadsides. Due to its toxicity, it is important to handle the plant with care.
